projectDescription: Redesign the Water Institute website to comply with UNC's new university-wide brand architecture. This includes retiring the standalone Water Institute logo, implementing the new Gillings School signature system, updating typography to Open Sans, and integrating the UNC website toolbar and argyle graphic elements across all pages.
estimatedTimeline: 4-6 weeks from kickoff to launch, with target completion by February 28, 2026 to meet UNC brand compliance deadline.
internalNotes: Tight deadline - UNC brand compliance required by Feb 28, 2026. Existing site built by Adrial Designs in Webflow. Brand guidelines are prescriptive which simplifies design decisions. 30 static pages + 14 CMS templates to update. No monthly hosting - UNC handles their own infrastructure.

phases.name: Brand Audit & Planning
phases.description: Comprehensive review of all 30 static pages and 14 CMS templates to map logo instances, typography usage, and graphic elements requiring updates. Document implementation roadmap aligned with UNC brand guidelines.

phases.name: Design System & Components
phases.description: Create new header component with UNC toolbar and typeset 'The Water Institute' text. Design updated footer with Gillings School signature. Establish Open Sans typography system and integrate argyle graphic elements per brand guidelines.

phases.name: Static Page Updates
phases.description: Apply new brand system to all 30 static pages: Homepage, About section (4 pages), Conference pages (14 pages), Our Work listings (10 pages), Join Us, and Donors page. Many conference pages share similar layouts.

phases.name: CMS Template Updates
phases.description: Update all 14 CMS collection templates: Team profiles, Projects, Knowledge articles, Research profiles, Conference archives, Events, Publications, Student blogs, Job openings, Announcements, and Conference-related templates.

phases.name: Development & Integration
phases.description: Implement all design updates in Webflow. Update CSS for new typography and color treatments. Integrate new header/footer components. Remove legacy Water Institute logo assets and replace with new brand elements.

phases.name: QA & Brand Compliance Review
phases.description: Cross-browser and device testing. Verify brand compliance against UNC guidelines across all pages. Final review with client and Gillings Communications team. Deploy to production.

## Brand Implementation Requirements

- **Logo:** Replace standalone Water Institute logo with Gillings School signature (interlocking NC + wordmark)
- **Unit Name:** "The Water Institute" typeset in Open Sans Bold, positioned per brand guidelines
- **Header:** Implement new UNC website toolbar with interlocking NC
- **Footer:** Gillings School or UNC signature
- **Typography:** Open Sans (Bold for headings, Regular for body)
- **Graphics:** Integrate argyle pattern elements where appropriate
- **Colors:** Maintain existing Carolina Blue, Navy palette
exclusions:
- Content creation or copywriting
- Photography or image sourcing
- CMS migration or backend changes
- SEO optimization beyond existing setup

- Print collateral design
